titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the National Park Service should form a committee for the purpose of establishing guidelines to launch a national design competition.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Mr. Hansen asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 11/15/2002--Passed House without amendment. Directs the National Park Service to form a committee to establish guidelines for launching a national design competition for a sculpture memorializing the Lewis and Clark Expedition to be built in Luther Ely Smith Park in downtown St. Louis, Missouri.
